yamataggi： yamataggi（pu）
ယမတဂ္ဂိ（ပု）
[yamada+aggi]
[ယမဒ+အဂ္ဂိ]

Yamataggi：A sage of old who led a good life and persuaded his followers to do likewise．

He was among the originators of the Vedic hymns．Vin．i．245； D．i．238，239； M．ii．169，200； A．iii．224，229； iv．61； also J．vi．251，where he is called Yāmataggi and is described as a king of old．Cp．Vedic Index，see Jamadagni．

yamataggi：ယမတဂ္ဂိ（ပု）
[ယမဒ+အဂ္ဂိ]
ယမဒဂ္ဂိ-ကြည့်။
